cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW across the Caribbean, then turning NW over central-western Cuba and into the Florida Straits, likely passing just SW of the Florida Keys before moving northward into the eastern Gulf of Mexico

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches yet for Florida peninsula – current watches cover Hispaniola, Jamaica, and Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings yet for Florida peninsula – current warnings cover Hispaniola and Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, South Florida east coast (including PortMiami) and southwest Florida likely to experience tropical-storm conditions early next week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible – forecast totals 2-4 inches with isolated 6 inches
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely – east-coast surge generally under 2 ft
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (30–45 mph) possible Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along Biscayne Bay at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain 2–4 in with local 6 in Monday-Tuesday, producing urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along Miami-Dade beaches
